repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fix #30965

Problem: Can receive dozens of <MouseMove> events for same character position. #30965

Solution: Leverage check_multiclick to detect position unchanged.

comment_data.body: This condition is not needed. When `code == KE_MOUSEMOVE` the function has already returned above.

It only returns above when there has been no move. When there has been a move it continues on since the current position must be saved.

After saving the current position there could be
```
if (code == KE_MOUSEMOVE) { return 0; }
```
but that looked messier.

The description of this test should be changed. Maybe to this:
```
<MouseMove> to different locations can be mapped
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1913,14 +1913,28 @@ describe('ui/mouse/input', function()
     api.nvim_set_var('mouse_move2', 0)
     command('nnoremap <MouseMove> <Cmd>let g:mouse_move += 1<CR>')
     command('nnoremap <2-MouseMove> <Cmd>let g:mouse_move2 += 1<CR>')
-    feed('<MouseMove><0,0>')
-    feed('<MouseMove><0,0>')
-    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 0)
-    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 0)
+    feed('<MouseMove><1,0>')
+    feed('<MouseMove><2,0>')
+    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 3)
+    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 4)

@@ -1913,14 +1913,28 @@ describe('ui/mouse/input', function()
     api.nvim_set_var('mouse_move2', 0)
     command('nnoremap <MouseMove> <Cmd>let g:mouse_move += 1<CR>')
     command('nnoremap <2-MouseMove> <Cmd>let g:mouse_move2 += 1<CR>')
-    feed('<MouseMove><0,0>')
-    feed('<MouseMove><0,0>')
-    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 0)
-    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 0)
+    feed('<MouseMove><1,0>')
+    feed('<MouseMove><2,0>')
+    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 3)
+    api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 0, 0, 4)

comment_data.body: The `continue;` should still be executed if `handle_mouse_event` returns `0`, otherwise if a key notation follows `<MouseMove>` (doesn't happen in Nvim TUI, but still possible) it won't be interpreted.
Oh crap. DONE. (and the following `if (*ptr == '<')` would quietly throw it away.

comment_regular_data.body:
There's a failure 
```
FAIL: /home/runner/work/neovim/neovim/src/nvim/os/input.c (File size changed from 16846 to 16853)
```
Where the from size is what I see with "ls -l". Either I can't reproduce this at home, I'm using the wrong command or I'm looking in the wrong spot for the error file.

Suggestions?

> Did you run `make format`?

And of course it's documented in `CONTRIBUTING.md`. Thanks.

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability

title: perf(mouse): only generate a <MouseMove> for a new character positon
